wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Henry Schwanfelder (1774–1837) was an English animal, landscape and portrait painter.
Schwanfelder was born and died in Leeds. He was the son of a German decorative painter and started out helping his father to paint clock faces and snuff boxes. He was renowned for his animal paintings and was appointed animal painter to George III and George IV.He exhibited at the Royal academy between 1809 and 1814

response: ** Charles Henry Schwanfelder, English animal, landscape and portrait painter (born 1774)
** Charles Henry Schwanfelder, English animal, landscape and portrait painter (died 1837)
The portrait of George Linley by Charles Henry Schwanfelder is held by Leeds Museums and Galleries.
